thread.title: ‘The Martian’ lifts off with a $55 million opening weekend - MarketWatch
thread.title_full: ‘The Martian’ lifts off with a $55 million opening weekend - MarketWatch

author: yahoo
title: ‘The Martian’ lifts off with a $55 million opening weekend - MarketWatch
text:
Ridley Scott’s latest science-fiction epic, “The Martian,” opened with a stellar $55 million weekend at the box office, based on studio estimates gathered by Rentrak.
The Matt Damon-led film from 20th Century Fox FOXA, +0.61% notched up the second biggest October opening weekend, just shy of first-placed “Gravity.” The earlier space disaster movie from Time Warner Inc.’s TWX, +0.32% Warner Bros earned $55.8 million in its debut weekend in 2013 before going on to nab seven Oscars.
Don’t miss: How Matt Damon could rocket NASA to Mars in real life 
“The Martian,” based on Andy Weir’s best-selling novel of the same name, was made on a budget of $108 million and garnered an A rating in a CinemaScore poll of audiences. It is Fox’s biggest opening so far this year, topping the Jim Parsons- and Rihanna-voiced animated flick “Home,” which earned an initial $52.1 million. 
“Hotel Transylvania 2” finished the weekend at No. 2 with a take of $33 million, after last week posting the best September opening ever for a film. The Sony Pictures Entertainment SNE, +2.19% film, led by Adam Sandler, took $48.5 million at the box office in its first week and its total domestic gross so far is $90.5 million.
Lions Gate Entertainment Corp.’s LGF, +1.37% film “Sicario”, about the drug war at the U.S. and Mexico border, earned the No.3 spot and an A- CinemaScore rating after moving to wide release. The film, led by Emily Blunt, raked in $12.1 million over the weekend. In its limited-theater opening, “Sicario” posted the best weekend of the year, in terms of revenue per location: it took in $390,000 at just six theaters, for $65,000 per theater.
Also read: Universal’s limited release of ‘Everest’ pays off as trend grows

Studio estimates from Rentrak
Sony released Joseph Gordon-Levitt’s “The Walk” in just 448 theaters on Imax IMAX, +2.64% screens only. The film, about Philippe Petit’s 1974 death-defying high-wire walk between the World Trade Center’s Twin Towers, earned $1.5 million on a modest $35 million budget. The film will be distributed on wide release on Friday.
